oai_dc:dc.dc:title: AT-SEA EXPERIMENT AND SITE MONITORING ON A NEW COASTAL PROTECTION ENGINEERING METHOD-ARTIFICIAL MARINE FOREST
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lin, Jing-Hua
Liu, Cheng-Chi
Hwang, Kao-Shu
Chen, Ching-Ju
Liang, Nai-Kuang
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A new engineering method on the coastal protection, "Artificial Marine Forest (AMF)" proposed by Liang et al. (2004) is composed by lots of tautly-moored floating structures (TMFS). The concept of this method is to establish a buffer zone between the shoreline and the sea area by building a dense forest to reduce the wave energy and protect the coast. When deploying a larger number of cylindrical floating bodies in the offshore region, the scene is similar to a marine forest.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 36 (2018): Proceedings of 36th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Baltimore, Maryland, 2018; risk.37
